org.gearvrf.scene_objects

Class GVRVideoSceneObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRSceneObject
        • org.gearvrf.scene_objects.GVRVideoSceneObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GVRVideoSceneObject
extends GVRSceneObject
    A scene object that shows video, using the Android MediaPlayer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GVRVideoSceneObject.GVRVideoType
      Video type constants, for use with GVRVideoSceneObject

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GVRVideoSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, float width, float height, MediaPlayer mediaPlayer, int videoType)
      Play a video on a 2D, rectangular scene object, using the Android MediaPlayer
      GVRVideoSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, GVRMesh mesh, MediaPlayer mediaPlayer, int videoType)
      Play a video on a scene object with an arbitrarily complex geometry, using the Android MediaPlayer

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRVideoSceneObject

        public GVRVideoSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                           GVRMesh mesh,
                           MediaPlayer mediaPlayer,
                           int videoType)
        Play a video on a scene object with an arbitrarily complex geometry, using the Android MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        mesh - a GVRMesh - see GVRContext.loadMesh(org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource) and GVRContext.createQuad(float, float)
        mediaPlayer - an Android MediaPlayer
        videoType - One of the video type constants
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on an invalid videoType parameter

      • GVRVideoSceneObject

        public GVRVideoSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                           float width,
                           float height,
                           MediaPlayer mediaPlayer,
                           int videoType)
        Play a video on a 2D, rectangular scene object, using the Android MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        width - the rectangle's width
        height - the rectangle's height
        mediaPlayer - an Android MediaPlayer
        videoType - One of the video type constants
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on an invalid videoType parameter

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Poll the MediaPlayer once per frame.

        This call does not directly affect the MediaPlayer. In particular, activation is not the same as calling MediaPlayer#start().

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Stop polling the MediaPlayer.

        This call does not directly affect the MediaPlayer. In particular, deactivation is not the same as calling MediaPlayer#pause().

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns the current MediaPlayer status. See activate() and deactivate(): polling activation is not correlated with the MediaPlayer state.
        Returns:
        Whether or not we polling the MediaPlayer every frame.

      • getMediaPlayer

        public MediaPlayer getMediaPlayer()
        Returns the current MediaPlayer, if any
        Returns:
        current MediaPlayer

      • setMediaPlayer

        public void setMediaPlayer(MediaPlayer mediaPlayer)
        Sets the current MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        mediaPlayer - An Android MediaPlayer

      • release

        public void release()
        Reset and release() the current MediaPlayer, if any

      • getTimeStamp

        public long getTimeStamp()
        Returns the current time stamp, in nanoseconds. This comes from SurfaceTexture#getTimestamp(): you should read the Android documentation on that before you use this value.
        Returns:
        current time stamp, in nanoseconds
